alert.note: Alert for Craighead (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 8:59PM CST until December 13 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following counties, Craighead and Greene. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jonesboro, Paragould, Bono, Lake City, Bay, Brookland, Marmaduke, Crowleys Ridge State Park, Lake Frierson State Park, Oak Grove Heights, Lafe, Walcott, Goobertown, Farrville, Finch, Bethel, Herndon, Lorado, Needham and Schug. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
